name: LookAheadConstraint
documentation:
A constraint that supports search-as-you-type functionality by matching terms or phrases that start with a given input string.

For example, the input {@code "hat"} will match documents containing terms like {@code "hatter"} or phrases like {@code "the cat with the hat"}.

The constraint delegates matching to an equivalent {@link ContainsConstraint} created via {@link #decompose()}.

If no paths are provided, the constraint will match across all paths in the document. @see QueryConstraint @see ContainsConstraint

fields.name: decompose
fields.documentation:
Decomposes this constraint into an equivalent {@link ContainsConstraint} with:
  • case-insensitive matching
  • word and phrase start matching enabled
  • value normalization applied

fields.name: lookAhead
fields.documentation: The look-ahead string used for matching. This acts as a prefix for partial term or phrase matching.

fields.name: paths
fields.documentation: Field paths where the search should be applied. If no paths are specified, all fields are considered.

methods.name: lookAhead
matches
matches
methods.documentation:
Not supported for this constraint type, as this constraint relies on higher-level document decomposition.

 @throws UnsupportedOperationException always
